info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 30 at 3:02PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17 affecting Hardee County. .Heavy rainfall associated with Hurricane Ian continues to cause major flooding issues along many area rivers. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 28.1 feet, Water reaches the U.S. 17 bridge roadbed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 26.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EDT Friday was 27.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 20.1 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 09/06/1933. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Peace River Zolfo Springs at 16.0 26.8 Fri 2 pm 23.0 20.5 20.1 19.9 19.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 615 AM EDT.
